TITLE: Petrichor Oil – Soaked Earth Fragrance - Mitti, Attar - A Geosmin Infused Perfume to Wear, Make Candles, Evoke Memories
DESCRIPTION:
I love this scent. It's a natural extract made from only one lake in Kannauj India. A summer storm in a bottle! The monsoons clearing the dust from the streets in india. This scent has many names -- petrichor, mitti, geosmine -- and Kannuaj is the only place in the world that I have found that extracts it naturally.

If you've ever tried CB I Hate Perfume's Soaked Earth accord, this smells vastly different. Less humus and more pavement during a summer shower. If you ask I can provide a sample of CB's accord to contrast. :)

This is rare stuff indeed and we bring it directly to you!


All of our oils are made using natural ingredients using traditional extraction methods. We source them ourselves from Kannauj India a city known to have been producing essential oils for the last 7000 years! The images above are from the factory visit in October 2015. Wear some history :). 

Here's the article on Kannauj that inspired us to visit:
www.theatlantic.com/international/archive/2015/04/making-perfume-from-the-rain/391011/

<3 Bilal & Josephine

TITLE: Cedar Tree Oil From Lebanon - Good for Asthma, Thinking Clearly, Breathing Deeply, Being So Fresh and So Clean Clean
DESCRIPTION:
This is a new oil that we're excited to bring to you straight from Lebanon! 
Join us on our trip to Lebanon to find one of the few people still extracting and manufacturing local oils and soaps! 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MP66aRfCpB4

We travelled to the heart of Cedar country to find some Asli* steam distilled oil. It has a powerful clearing scent, it opens both my lungs and my mind when I smell it.

It's a little bit like a forest in a bottle. A little goes a long way. Careful now.

As always curious how you use this oil! Please leave us some feedback! :)

TITLE: Jasmine Perfume Oil - a delicate and sweet floral scent - Wear me, Diffuse me.
DESCRIPTION:
If you've ever been to India, this perfume oil infused with Indian Jasmine will take you back for less than the price of a ticket. Smelling it reminds me of a beautiful time in the temple city of Hampi. This oil has a light floral and fruity top note and a mellow earthy base.

Try it in your next perfume mix or wear it direct from the bottle. This is an all natural oil which is great for many uses:
Soaps, candles, air fresheners, skin and hair care, and more.


All of our oils are made using natural ingredients using traditional extraction methods. We source them ourselves from Kannauj India a city known to have been producing essential oils for the last 7000 years! The images above are from the factory visit in October 2015. Wear some history :).

TITLE: Pure Sandalwood Perfume Oil - A smooth, subtly sweet woody scent, calming and ordering. Wear it, diffuse it, meditate with it, enjoy :)
DESCRIPTION:
Enjoy a pure sandalwood essential oil. For thousands of years it has been long used as a cosmetic and fragrance due to it's calming and harmonizing effect on the mind. This makes sandalwood great to use for meditation. 

This sandalwood is gently powerful, woody, oily and delicious. A warm scent to treat yourself or your loved ones on a cold day. It makes me happy just smelling it and I hope it does the same for you.


All of our oils are made using natural ingredients using traditional extraction methods. We source them ourselves from Kannauj India a city known to have been producing essential oils for the last 7000 years! The images above are from the factory visit in October 2015. Wear some history :). 

Here's the article on Kannauj that inspired us to visit:

TITLE: Vetiver Fragrance Oil – A deep and rich earthy grassy scent. Long lasting. Powerful. Use in candles, perfumes, soaps and more :)
DESCRIPTION:
This smell is a strong earthy smell. Grassy and green. This oil is quite thick and the scent remains on your skin for a long time and can help bring some balance if you're feeling a bit up in the air :).

What's called Khas in India is Vetiver in English. This oil is often used on the neck during the hot Indian summers for the cooling effect it has. 

Try a 1 gram sample and see how you can incorporate this robust scent into your next project. This is an all natural oil which is great for many uses:
Soaps, candles, air fresheners, skin and hair care, and more.

+Bilal & Josephine

All our oils are coming from Kannauj India and extracted using traditional methods that this village has been known to be using for the last 7000 years. Wear some history. Here's an article on Kannauj:
www.theatlantic.com/international/archive/2015/04/making-perfume-from-the-rain/391011/

TITLE: Natural Henna Perfume Oil - Spicy and butter scent to get you into the wedding mood. Great for hair care, massage into scalp :)
DESCRIPTION:
Henna oil is complex - it's a spicy smell with high notes of fresh crushed leaves and a rounded bottom with hints of butter. If you've been to an Arab or Desi wedding you will recognize this scent. 

This is the smell of celebration! Sabika helped us chose our oils, when she sampled this scent she paused and smiled and said: "This is how I want to smell when I get married." Perhaps you will too :) 

Henna oil has long been used in India to promote hair growth and a healthy sheen. It's said to help with dandruff and also prevent hair loss. Try it in your next perfume mix or wear it direct from the bottle.  This is an all natural oil which is great for many uses:
Soaps, candles, air fresheners, skin and hair care, and more.


All of our oils are made using natural ingredients using traditional extraction methods. We source them ourselves from Kannauj India a city known to have been producing essential oils for the last 7000 years! The images above are from the factory visit in October 2015. Wear some history :).

TITLE: Rose Perfume Oil - An all natural sweet floral scent to remind you of garden walks - use in your perfumes and soap making
DESCRIPTION:
The smell of roses is a classic smell, sweet and flowery - a great note for mixes. Roses have been as important to sages as it is to romantics. Often you'll find shrines in india with roses everywhere, Sufi's love the rose and carpet places of worship with petals :)


All of our oils are made using natural ingredients using traditional extraction methods. We source them ourselves from Kannauj India a city known to have been producing essential oils for the last 7000 years! The images above are from the factory visit in October 2015. Wear some history :).
